advancements.via_romana.a_strand_type_ga: Use strands to connect the world
message.via_romana.invalid_dimension: Charting in current dimension not allowed
message.via_romana.entity_not_allowed: Warping with current entity not allowed
message.via_romana.unsafe: Cannot warp to an unsafe destination
gui.viaromana.warp_block.title: Warp Block
gui.viaromana.no_access_tooltip: You do not have permission to edit this destination
gui.viaromana.add_to_path_tooltip: Add this sign to path network
gui.viaromana.place_near_node_tooltip: Place near a path node to link
gui.viaromana.configure_sign_link.title: Configure Sign Link
gui.viaromana.charting_screen.title: Charting Screen
gui.viaromana.sever_path_confirmation: Are you sure you want to sever the path?
gui.viaromana.delete_branch_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete all connected nodes?
gui.viaromana.node_distance_tooltip: Must be within %.0f blocks of a node
gui.viaromana.chart_continue_tooltip: Continue charting path from nearby node
gui.viaromana.delete_branch_detailed_too: Delete connected path nodes up to nearest endpoint or junction
gui.viaromana.message.via_romana.finish_: Finish charting path by connecting to nearby node
gui.viaromana.tooltip.infrastructure: Includes paths, bricks, wooden, and otherwise processed blocks
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_1: Start by charting and walking on a valid path using your Charting Map
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_2: A valid path consists of ! at least %s blocks wide
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_3: Nodes will be placed automatically along your path
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_4: Create a destination by placing a sign near a node and linking it via right clicking it
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_5: You can access the warp screen by left clicking the linked sign
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_6: Linked signs can be destroyed by sneaking and breaking them, or unlinking them
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_7: Severing a path will remove the nearest node from the path
gui.viaromana.tutorial_page_8: Removing a branch will remove all nodes up to the nearest endpoint or junction
via_romana.midnightconfig.title: Via Romana Config
via_romana.midnightconfig.infrastructure:
The radius (in blocks) to check around the player for node placement (eg. 1 block radius = 3 x 3 area check).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.node_distance_:
The minimum distance (in blocks) between two nodes.
 • Server Managed

The maximum distance (in blocks) between two nodes.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.node_utility_d:
The distance (in blocks) to select the nearest node from for actions like connect, sever, and delete.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.path_quality_t:
Minimum percentage of valid infrastructure blocks required to place a node (eg. 0.3 = 30% of a 2D slice of area check).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.travel_fatigue:
Cooldown (in seconds) before a player can warp again.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.charting_foote: • Check the 'Visuals' tab for charting visuals.
via_romana.midnightconfig.fog_of_war_dis:
The radius (in chunks) around charted areas that will be rendered on the map (this will impact performance).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.spline_animati: The speed at which the teleport screen path animates (this will impact performance).
via_romana.midnightconfig.maximum_map_di:
The maximum dimension (in blocks) of the generated map texture (this will impact performance).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.map_refresh_in:
The interval (in seconds) to refresh any maps (this will impact performance).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.map_refresh_th:
The amount of chunks required to allow a refresh of any maps (this will impact performance).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.map_save_inter:
The interval (in minutes) to save the map cache to disk.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.enable_surveyo:
Adds destinations as a landmark through Surveyor.
 • Server Managed

Colors all landmarks in the same network the same colour to indicate connections.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.biomeColor.too:
Format: biome_id=map_color
• biome_id: A valid Minecraft biome ID (e.g., minecraft:plains).
• map_color: Integer index for a map color (0-61, check wiki).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.use_biome_fall: Use Biome Fallback for Low Resolution

When enabled, uses biome data instead of rendering chunks for low-resolution maps, improving performance with minimal quality loss.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.map_footer: • Check the 'Visuals' tab for map visuals.
via_romana.midnightconfig.invalid_entiti:
List of entity IDs that cannot warp.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.invalid_dimens:
List of dimension IDs where warping is disabled.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.path_block_ids:
List of block IDs considered valid for paths.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.path_block_tag:
List of block tags considered valid for paths.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.path_block_str:
Substrings to search for in block IDs to consider them valid for paths.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.warp_block_ids:
List of block IDs that can act as warp blocks.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.warp_block_tag:
List of block tags that can act as warp blocks.
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.block_string_b:
Substrings to search for in block IDs to exclude them from being valid for paths (used to avoid crashes with other mods).
 • Server Managed
via_romana.midnightconfig.warp_footer: • Check the 'Visuals' tab for warping visuals.
via_romana.midnightconfig.invalid_block_: Highlights blocks that do not count as valid infrastructure for charting. Set to 0 to disable.
via_romana.midnightconfig.biome_map_opac: The opacity of the biome fallback texture in Teleport Map Screen.
via_romana.midnightconfig.node_vignette_: The opacity of the vignette displayed when close to a node.
via_romana.midnightconfig.enable_telepor: Enables particle effects during player warping.
command.via_romana.no_legacy_paths: No legacy paths found to convert
command.via_romana.dimension_has_nodes: Current dimension already has nodes. Use /viaromana nodes clear first.
command.via_romana.legacy_converted:
Converted legacy nodes to current dimension
 • Accessing the maps of legacy paths may cause a one-time lag spike.
 • Deleting your existing via_romana.json config and letting it regenerate is strongly recommended.
command.via_romana.maps_and_chunks_clear: Cleared Via Romana maps and chunk images
command.via_romana.maps_and_biomes_clear: Cleared Via Romana maps and biome images
command.via_romana.maps_saved: Saved Via Romana maps to disk
